results.purpose: Recipe development planning and brainstorming tracker for culinary strategy across different meal preferences and dietary programs
key_data_points: Multiple meal categories: Medically-Tailored Meals, Add On, Longevity, Chef's Choice, Gourmet+, GLP-1 Support, Calorie Smart
Protein types tracked: Chicken (Breast, Diced, Shredded), Turkey (Sliced), Salmon (Filet), Tofu, Shrimp (Whole), Seafood (Sea Bass), Beef & Pork (Meatball)
Recipe concepts include: Chicken Shawarma Grain Bowl, Tofu grain bowls, Hong Kong Shrimp & Tofu, Salmon Provençal, Hungarian Salmon, Oaxacan Spiced Salmon

entities.name: SH
entities.context: Chef assigned to Medically-Tailored Meals chicken and turkey recipes, and Calorie Smart rework

entities.name: JCV
entities.context: Chef assigned to Medically-Tailored Meals salmon recipes

entities.name: MJ
entities.context: Chef assigned to Medically-Tailored Meals diced chicken recipes

entities.name: NS
entities.context: Chef assigned to Add On grain bowl recipes (chicken shawarma and tofu)

entities.name: MC
entities.context: Chef assigned to Medically-Tailored Meals diced chicken recipes

entities.name: MT
entities.context: Chef assigned to Longevity/GLP-1 Support shrimp and salmon recipes

entities.name: LH
entities.context: Chef assigned to Gourmet+ sea bass recipes and GLP-1 Support meatball recipes

entities.name: FA0298E
entities.context: Greek Grilled Chicken Grain Bowl - existing recipe to differentiate from

entities.name: FA0335B
entities.context: Ginger Tofu & Thai Peanut Sauce - previous recipe that failed shelf life

entities.name: F01751A
entities.context: Thai-Style Peanut & Mango Chicken Bowl - failed scale up, needs R&D rework

entities.name: F01476A
entities.context: Pesto Cream Chicken & Rice - Calorie Smart recipe needing potential rework

entities.name: Brett
entities.context: Location/facility where tofu grain bowls failed shelf life testing

entities.name: Tricia
entities.context: Person to confirm rework requirements with

entities.name: Abby
entities.context: Person to confirm rework requirements with

insights: Heavy focus on health-oriented meal categories: Medically-Tailored Meals, Longevity, GLP-1 Support, and Calorie Smart
Mediterranean Diet guardrails are a recurring requirement across multiple recipe categories
Shelf life testing is a critical constraint - previous tofu recipe failed at Brett facility
Global flavor expansion is a priority for grain bowl offerings (Middle Eastern, Thai, etc.)
Multiple concepts (3-4) are being developed per protein/preference combination for evaluation
Gourmet+ line has significant volume with 13 sea bass entries all assigned to chef LH for slot 75
GLP-1 Support recipes are being designed with intention to convert beef/pork meatballs to turkey when specifications are available
Recipe development follows structured timeline: brainstorm (12/17) → review (12/17) → taste testing (1/28)
Add-ons team is driving requirements for grain bowl development as 1-count bento format
Some recipes require rework due to failed scale-up or need to meet updated nutritional guardrails

results.purpose: Onboarding checklist tracking training completion for new product team members (Deo and Beatrice)
key_data_points: Deo completion status: 10 items completed out of 19 total
Beatrice completion status: 4 items completed out of 19 total
3 main categories: Content (7 items), Tool (1 item), Training (8 items)
Primary trainer: YT (appears in 17 of 19 items)
Key metrics covered: CCV/CAC (Customer Conversion Value/Customer Acquisition Cost), CVA

entities.name: Deo
entities.context: New team member being onboarded, completed 10 training items

entities.name: Beatrice
entities.context: New team member being onboarded, completed 4 training items (GA4, CUI, Tableau, Instapage)

entities.name: YT
entities.context: Primary presenter/trainer for onboarding sessions

entities.name: CP
entities.context: Presenter for Protein Deep Dives content

entities.name: HFG (Hello Fresh Group)
entities.context: Parent company, DNA and values training included

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Product brand being worked on, multiple references to brand guidelines and reviews

entities.name: iTracker
entities.context: Tool for tracking spend, CCV/CAC, and channel inspection

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Data platform training (SQL-focused)

entities.name: GA4
entities.context: Google Analytics 4 training tool

entities.name: Tableau
entities.context: Data visualization tool for training

entities.name: Instapage
entities.context: Landing page tool for training

entities.name: CUI
entities.context: Internal system/tool requiring training

insights: Deo is further along in onboarding (10/19 completed) compared to Beatrice (4/19 completed)
Both team members have completed the same 4 tool-based trainings: GA4, CUI, Tableau, and Instapage
Neither team member has completed SQL/Databricks training, Protein Deep Dives, or historical learning documents
YT is the primary knowledge holder and trainer, presenting 17 of 19 sessions
Onboarding focuses heavily on analytics tools and metrics (CCV/CAC, CVA) suggesting data-driven product roles
Several 2024 review documents are incomplete for both members, possibly indicating recent additions or lower priority items
The checklist includes both company culture (HFG DNA, Good Chop Values) and technical skills training
External training resource referenced: DataCamp for SQL introduction

results.purpose: Product development roadmap for Good Chop spanning 2025-2027, tracking strategic initiatives, team capacity, and project timelines across quarters
key_data_points: Timeline spans Q1 2025 through Q1 2027 (53 weeks per year)
Legal deadlines: July 14, 2025 (Funnel, Cancellation deflection) and August 18, 2025 (all changes published)
Dev capacity ranges from 11.2 to 45 SP (story points) depending on team availability
Grace period ended April 15, 2025 for Free add-ons

insights: Heavy focus on Wallet-related initiatives in early 2025 (Q1-Q2), including migration, campaigns, and full launch
Team capacity significantly impacted by leaves: maternity leave (Areeba until Q4 2026), paternity leave (Bolo for 3 months from Oct 17), and various OOO periods
Strategic decision made to pause new Dashboard development after Milestone 1 in favor of CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Multiple legal compliance deadlines throughout 2025, with extended deadlines for various flows
Peak period preparation is a major focus with specific resource allocation notes
Engineering capacity varies significantly: 23/53 days, 30/53 days, 45/53 days noted at different periods
Product discovery and design work runs parallel to development, with handovers scheduled strategically
Migration activities clustered in Q4 2025 (Pricing service, Cash Credits)
OTP (One-Time Purchase) is a major 2026 initiative with tracking infrastructure created in late 2025
Cross-functional coordination evident with PA (Product Analytics), Design, and Product Discovery tracks running in parallel
Holiday periods explicitly marked with no-merge days to reduce deployment risk

insights: Heavy focus on Wallet and Dashboard initiatives in early 2025, with Wallet achieving full launch by Q1
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) impacting Q3-Q4 2025
Legal compliance is a major constraint with multiple deadlines extending into Q3 2025
Strategic pivot noted: Dashboard paused after Milestone 1 in favor of CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Peak period preparation is critical, with multiple projects timed around it
Product discovery and design work runs 1-2 quarters ahead of development
Ecommerce enhancements (search, product cards, filtering) scheduled for mid-2025
OTP (One-Time Purchase) is a major 2026 initiative spanning design, reactivation, and future deliveries
Team operates on 2-week sprints with capacity measured in story points
Multiple system migrations planned: Pricing service (mid-October), Cash Credits (W45)

insights: Team capacity significantly impacted by extended leaves (maternity and paternity) reducing from 6 to 4-5 developers
Major focus on Wallet launch and migration in Q1 2025 with multiple UAT phases
Dashboard initiative paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives

Peak season preparation is critical focus with specific tracking requirements for INP resolution
OTP (One-Time Purchase) is a major 2026 initiative with design work starting Q3 2025
Strategic initiatives allocated 70% of development capacity, leaving 30% for other work
Multiple system migrations and deprecations scheduled (Voucher, Cash Credits, Pricing service, Price Deprecation)
Product discovery and design work runs 1-2 quarters ahead of development implementation
Significant coordination required around holidays and team availability (Easter, May 1, various OOO periods)

insights: Significant team capacity fluctuations due to multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) throughout 2025-2026
Heavy focus on legal compliance with multiple deadlines for funnel and cancellation flow updates
Wallet project is a major strategic initiative with phased rollout including UAT testing and voucher migration
Dashboard initiative was paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Peak season preparation is critical with specific tracking requirements and resource allocation
Multiple system migrations planned: Pricing service (mid-Oct), Cash Credits (W45), with dependencies noted
Engineering capacity drops significantly during certain periods (23/53 and 30/53 engineering days noted)
Cross-functional coordination across Design, Product Discovery, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Welcome kit items and related funnel communications are key deliverables in Q2 2025
Reactivation and ecommerce initiatives span multiple quarters with iterative design phases
